conclusion: To determine the time during which there is an induced current in the frame, we need to consider the motion of the frame through the magnetic field and the conditions under which an induced current occurs.
The frame is a square with side length \( l \). The magnetic field has a width \( d \) and is uniform. The frame moves with a constant speed \( v \). The condition given is \( l < d \).
An induced current occurs when the magnetic flux through the frame changes. This happens when the frame enters or exits the magnetic field.

premise: The frame starts entering the magnetic field when the left side of the frame reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field.
conclusion: The frame fully enters the magnetic field when the right side of the frame reaches the left boundary of the magnetic field. The time taken for the frame to fully enter the magnetic field is \( \frac{l}{v} \).

premise: The frame starts exiting the magnetic field when the left side of the frame reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field.
conclusion: The frame fully exits the magnetic field when the right side of the frame reaches the right boundary of the magnetic field. The time taken for the frame to fully exit the magnetic field is \( \frac{l}{v} \).

premise: The total time during which there is an induced current is the sum of the time taken to enter and exit the magnetic field.
